description: Pure JavaScript web application patterns and best practices
author: VIBE IDE Team

aiSuggestions.context: You are helping create a vanilla JavaScript web application (no frameworks). Common patterns include: DOM manipulation with querySelector/getElementById, event handling with addEventListener, async operations with fetch API and async/await, ES6 modules for code organization, simple state management, form handling, localStorage/sessionStorage for persistence, class-based components for organization. Always use modern ES6+ syntax (const/let, arrow functions, template literals, destructuring, async/await). Avoid jQuery and old patterns. Use semantic HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript.

commonBugs: Forgetting to wait for DOM - Use DOMContentLoaded event
Memory leaks from event listeners - Remove listeners when done
Not handling async errors - Always use try/catch with async/await
Mutating arrays/objects directly - Use immutable patterns
Not checking if element exists - Always check before manipulating
Race conditions with async - Use Promise.all or proper sequencing
Not sanitizing user input - Always validate and sanitize
Using var instead of const/let - Use modern variable declarations
performanceTips: Use event delegation for dynamic elements
Use documentFragment for multiple DOM operations
Avoid inline styles - Use CSS classes

bestPractices.code: Use ES6+ syntax, organize with modules
bestPractices.dom: Cache DOM queries, use event delegation
bestPractices.state: Keep state simple, update UI when state changes
